content.question: Which of the following statements about Fan Kuanâ€™s painting Travelers among Mountains and Streams reflects the approach to landscape that the work embodies?

choices.label: It is more important to depict the essence of the landscape than to represent an actual place in detail.
The artist should not work within a studio, and instead should paint directly from nature.
Rather than attempting to represent nature accurately, artists should always use standardized forms.
The way in which nature is represented should honor the ruling dynasty at the time a work is made.

content.answer: It is more important to depict the essence of the landscape than to represent an actual place in detail.
